data.title: Baldwin shares surge 26% on 2026 guidance, CEO sees AI as enabler
data.description:
By Michael Loney

The Baldwin Group’s share price closed up 26% on Friday following the release of Q4 results and 2026 guidance, while its CEO said he sees artificial intelligence as an “enabler” for the insurance intermediary.

Tampa-based Baldwin after markets closed on Thursday reported adjusted diluted earnings per share increased 15% in the fourth quarter to $0.31, just beating analysts' expectations.

Organic revenue growth fell 16 points year on year to 3% as the broker’s adjusted Ebitda margin ticked up 1 point to 20.1%.

For the full year, organic revenue growth was 7% while overall revenue grew 8% to $1.51 billion.

In an investor presentation, Baldwin provided full-year guidance for 2026 of between $2.01 billion and $2.05 billion of total revenue and mid-single-digits or higher organic revenue growth, with double-digit growth by Q4.

It also expects between $460 million and $480 million adjusted EBITDA and between $2.00 and $2.10 adjusted diluted earnings per share.

Nasdaq-listed Baldwin’s share price closed at $23.23 on Friday, up 25.6% from the previous day’s close.

In a results release, Baldwin CEO Trevor Baldwin hailed 2025 as “a year of significant progress” for the Tampa-based company.

“We delivered our sixth consecutive year of top-of-industry organic growth, expanded margins and grew adjusted diluted EPS by double digits — all while navigating meaningful near-term headwinds that will shortly be behind us,” the executive said.

These headwinds were highlighted in the investor presentation as a revenue recognition change in the insurance advisory solutions (IAS) group, a QBE builder book transition, Medicare market disruption and the IAS rate and exposure environment.

“With the addition of CAC Group and the launch of our $3B/30 Catalyst program, we are entering 2026 with the strongest platform in our history and a clear path to accelerate performance and stakeholder outcomes,” Trevor Baldwin said.

The executive added that Baldwin’s embedded insurance platforms, advisory business serving complex clients and vertically integrated model across underwriting, distribution and risk capital “represent durable competitive moats that AI will enhance, not displace.”

AI WILL BE COMPETITOR AND ENABLER FOR BROKERS

On an investor call on Thursday, Trevor Baldwin expanded on his views about AI.

He noted the selloff of insurance stocks earlier in February after the launch of AI-powered insurance applications in ChatGPT triggered fears of widespread broker disintermediation.

Trevor Baldwin said this had the effect of “eviscerating nearly $40 billion of market capitalization across our public broker peers in a matter of days.”

“The critical question being debated today is whether AI will be a true competitor to brokers or an enabler for them. I believe the answer is both,” he said.

The executive said that firms operating as transactional middlemen and commoditized insurance product lines “should be concerned.”

But for his firm he described AI as a “step-function multiplier,” enabling significant gains in productivity and enhancing organizational speed and agility.

This includes in personal lines, which comprises 38% of Baldwin’s total pro forma revenue. Around 80% of this revenue emanates from embedded insurance, which its CEO said represents “one of the ultimate moats in this environment.”

“While the market is worrying about consumers asking a chatbot for insurance in our embedded businesses, we are focused on being the insurance solution of convenience sold through a trusted partner alongside a primary transaction such as buying a home, securing a mortgage or renting an apartment,” he said.

The executive said Baldwin’s Westwood platform, which is inclusive of business acquired from Hippo, generated $190 million in pro forma revenue in 2025 and “seamlessly embeds directly into the home-buying experience for 20 of the top 25 homebuilders in the United States.”

Baldwin onboarded 12 new partners on the platform in 2025.

The company this week signed a 10-year exclusive agreement with Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation, the sixth largest independent mortgage lender in the U.S.

“We currently expect to go live with Fairway on our Coverage Navigator platform in the second quarter,” Trevor Baldwin said. “The growing momentum here is palpable and will drive deeper moats around our embedded business.”

Baldwin’s renters insurance platform, which wrote over $280 million of premium in 2025, embeds directly into property management software, allowing a renter to purchase an insurance policy at point of lease in under 60 seconds.

“100% of the premium flowing through this channel is into our own proprietary products built and managed by our MGA platform, MSI. Overall, these embedded solutions are easier, more intuitive and more seamless than initiating a separate process with a stand-alone AI agent,” Trevor Baldwin said.

data.title: Trump Orders Federal Agencies to Phase Out Anthropic Technology. This Is Why. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Evie Liu

President Donald Trump said on Friday that he is directing all federal agencies to phase out the use of technology developed by artificial intelligence company Anthropic, including its Claude models.

The announcement came amid the escalating dispute between the company and the Department of Defense. The directive was issued shortly before the Pentagon's deadline for Anthropic to agree to broader military access to its systems.

Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has refused to accede to Pentagon demands that would allow its AI tools to be used without the company's restrictions, particularly in scenarios involving lethal force, surveillance or other high-stakes applications.

Trump said on Friday that most federal agencies must immediately cease using Anthropic's technology, and they would have a six-month window to remove the systems where they are already embedded.

"We don't need it, we don't want it and will not do business with them again!" Trump said in a post on Truth Social.

Write to Evie Liu at evie.liu@barrons.com

data.title: Canada Says OpenAI's Safety Pledges Lack Details — Update
data.description:
By Paul Vieira

OTTAWA--OpenAI's pledges to strengthen security protocols are missing key details including how they will be implemented, Canada's minister in charge of artificial intelligence said.

Minister for Artificial Intelligence Evan Solomon is also demanding greater clarity on OpenAI's operations, including how troubling interactions with the ChatGPT chatbot are escalated, and how privacy considerations are balanced with public safety.

Solomon issued a statement Friday, roughly 24 hours after OpenAI wrote to the minister and pledged to bolster safety protocols. OpenAI said that with the changes, it would have referred the account belonging to Jesse Van Rootselaar to police if it was discovered today. Police have identified Van Rootselaar as the suspect in a deadly school shooting in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia that left eight dead and dozens injured.

The Wall Street Journal has reported that OpenAI considered alerting Canadian law-enforcement authorities about interactions between Van Rootselaar and ChatGPT. OpenAI shut down Van Rootselaar's ChatGPT account after detecting a violation of its policy but didn't notify police.

Solomon said he's also scheduled to speak to OpenAI Chief Executive Sam Altman next week. A spokeswoman for OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment. A spokesman for Solomon said the timing and location have yet to be determined.

A meeting with Solomon marks the second senior Canadian politician Altman has agreed to speak with. British Columbia Premier David Eby said he's also set to speak to Altman, and Eby added he wants the CEO to be cognizant of the pain that families in Tumbler Ridge are feeling.

Online platforms have long debated how to balance questions of privacy with public safety in their decisions to alert law enforcement about certain users. That debate has now pulled in the AI companies that power the chatbots to which people are confiding the most intimate details of their private thoughts and lives.

In its letter to Solomon, OpenAI divulged that Van Rootselaar had a second ChatGPT account. Among OpenAI's pledges is a commitment to strengthen detection systems to prevent efforts to evade safeguards.

Taylor Owen, a public-policy professor at Montreal's McGill University with a specialty in media and ethics, said OpenAI has now publicly acknowledged its previous safety protocols were inadequate, and that Van Rootselaar's ability to create a second account discloses a previously unknown system error.

"It means the threshold that governed the original decision, the one that resulted in Canadian police not being contacted about violent content flagged by the company's own systems, was one the company itself now considers inadequate," Owen said. OpenAI's pledges, he added, follows a pattern among social-media platforms "where product safety changes come only after an incident forces them."

Solomon said he will press Altman about ensuring the pledges are fully implemented and enforced.

"We will be seeking further clarity on how human review is conducted and whether Canadian context and best practices are appropriately embedded in those decisions," the minister said.

Solomon added that intends to meet other major digital platforms in the coming weeks to advocate for a consistent approach on protecting youths and the public.

Write to Paul Vieira at paul.vieira@wsj.com

data.title: Fomento Económico Mexicano to Propose 3.7% Dividend Increase
data.description:
By Katherine Hamilton

Fomento Económico Mexicano plans to propose a 3.7% increase to its dividend and initiate a special dividend.

The company, which provides bottling services and operates a convenience store chain, said Friday its board will propose the dividends at the upcoming shareholder meeting.

The increased dividends would be 99 pesos, or 0.06 cents, per FEMSAUB unit, and 1.19 pesos per FEMSAUBD unit. The increase would keep up with inflation in Mexico, Fomento said.

The board also plans to propose an extraordinary dividend in four quarterly installments of 1.68 pesos per FEMSAUB unit and 2.01 pesos per FEMSAUBD unit.

The dividends would be distributed starting in April.

Write to Katherine Hamilton at katherine.hamilton@wsj.com

data.title: Bitcoin price slump versus gold’s gains highlights evolving crypto market
data.description:
Bitcoin (BTC) and gold are showing very different profiles in 2026. Gold has climbed 153% since the start of 2024, while Bitcoin is down roughly 30% over the same stretch. 

One analyst said that the gap lines up with steady growth in global money supply, cooling appetite for risky tech stocks, and falling crypto exchange balances. Together, these changes are shaping how both assets are trading in the market. 

Rising liquidity and tech stock speculation fail to supercharge Bitcoin

In an X post, Fidelity director of global macro, Jurrien Timmer said that gold has behaved as expected in a bull market, with sharp pullbacks attracting short-term buyers. Timmer described gold as a pure “hard money” asset that has tracked global money supply growth closely.

Bitcoin follows the global money supply growth over time, shown by the steady rise in global M2 (orange line). When M2 expands, BTC has generally trended higher. However, the chart shows that Bitcoin’s strongest rallies occurred when liquidity growth aligned with rising software and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) stocks, each being a proxy for speculative appetite.

In 2017–2018 and again in 2020–2021, the software stocks posted gains of roughly 58% and 93% year-over-year, and Bitcoin price rallied sharply during those periods. In 2022, software stocks fell by around 58%, and Bitcoin experienced a deep drawdown even as the money supply levels stayed elevated. 

The data shows that money supply growth supports the long-term trend, while shifts in tech-sector speculation tend to amplify or dampen Bitcoin’s price swings. This indicates that Bitcoin carries hard money exposure and high-beta characteristics, amplifying moves in both directions.

Timmer noted that liquidity is ample while speculative sentiment sits in a bear phase. In this scenario, gold and money supply have rallied together, while Bitcoin has struggled to keep pace.

Related: Bitcoin threatens new breakdown as US PPI sends gold to 1-month high

Gold draws demand on crypto exchanges

Demand on crypto-native platforms has also rotated toward gold-linked products. On Jan. 5, Binance launched 24-hour, 7-day gold futures trading. The cumulative volume of this product is approaching $35 billion, with more than $4 billion recorded on the most active day. The weekly volume averages about $4.7 billion, according to crypto analyst Darkfost. 

Activity accelerated immediately after gold posted a two-day correction exceeding 20%. The spike highlights the demand for tokenized exposure to traditional hard assets within crypto venues.

At the same time, CryptoQuant data shows Binance’s total portfolio value across BTC, ETH, XRP, and major ERC20 and TRC20 stablecoins has fallen to roughly $102 billion. That marks the lowest reading since April 2025, down from about $140 billion in August 2025.

The $38 billion decline reflects lower asset prices and user withdrawals into self-custody during bearish volatility.

For Bitcoin, this points to reduced capital on exchanges, which may signal cautious trader positioning and thin near-term liquidity. 

Related: Bitcoin to $30K? Analysts debate when and at what price BTC will bottom

As a result, the Fund may suffer losses if it invests in equity instruments of issuers whose performance diverges from the Fund's investment manager's expectations or if equity markets generally move in a single direction and the Fund has not hedged against such a general move. The Fund invests in closed-end funds and SPACs, which are subject to additional risks and considerations. The performance of reinsurance-related securities and the reinsurance industry itself are tied to the occurrence of various triggering events, including but not limited to weather, natural disasters (hurricanes, earthquakes, etc.), non-natural large catastrophes and other specified events causing physical and/or economic loss. To the extent the Fund invests in reinsurance-related securities for which a triggering event occurs, losses associated with such event could result in losses to the Fund's investment, and a series of major triggering events affecting a large portion of the reinsurance- related securities held by the Fund could result in substantial losses to the Fund's investment. The Fund may invest in high yield securities, which are speculative in nature and are subject to additional risk factors such as increased possibility of default, illiquidity of the security, and changes in value based on changes in interest rates. Changes in short-term market interest rates may directly affect the yield on the Fund's common shares. If such rates fall, the Fund's yield may also fall. If interest rate spreads on bonds and loans owned by the Fund decline in general, the yield on the bonds and loans will likely fall and the value of such bonds and loans may decrease. When short-term market interest rates rise, because of the lag between changes in such short-term rates and the resetting of the floating rates on bonds and loans in the Fund's portfolio, the impact of rising rates will be delayed to the extent of such lag. Because of the limited secondary market for certain bonds and loans, the Fund's ability to sell such securities in a timely fashion and/or at a favorable price may be limited. An increase in the demand for bonds and loans may adversely affect the rate of interest payable on new bonds and loans acquired by the Fund, and it may also increase the price of bonds and loans purchased by the Fund in the secondary market. A decrease in the demand for bonds and loans may adversely affect the price of bonds and loans in the Fund's portfolio, which would cause the Fund's net asset value to decrease. The Fund's use of leverage, if any, through borrowings or issuance of preferred shares can adversely affect the yield on the Fund's common shares. Investment in foreign borrowers involves special risks, including but not limited to potentially less rigorous accounting requirements, differing legal systems and potential political, social and economic adversity. The Fund may engage in currency exchange transactions to seek to hedge, as closely as practicable, all of the economic impact to the Fund arising from foreign currency fluctuations. Other risks include, but are not limited to, the use of derivatives, the potential lack of diversification in the Fund's portfolio, and the fact that the Fund's portfolio may be concentrated in a small group of industries or industry sectors from time to time. Investors should consult the Fund's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission as well as the materials on the Fund's website for a more detailed discussion of these or other risk factors that affect the Fund.

data.title: Azitra, Inc. Announces Full Year 2025 Results and Provides Business Updates
data.description:
BRANFORD, Conn., Feb. 27, 2026 /PRNewswire/ — Azitra, Inc. ("Azitra") (NYSE American: AZTR), a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing innovative therapies for precision dermatology, today reported financial results for the full year ended December 31, 2025, and provided a business update.

FY 2025 and Recent Business Highlights

  • Initiated Phase 1/2 Trial for ATR-04 program targeting oncology patients with EGFRi-associated rash; presented ATR-04 trial design and update at ASCO 2025
  • Announced positive preclinical data for ATR-01 program, targeting the treatment of ichthyosis vulgaris
  • Reported promising safety data from Phase 1b Trial of ATR12 in Netherton Syndrome
  • Completed financings of $8.5 million through private placements, follow-on financings and utilization of an equity line of credit.

"2025 was an exciting year for Azitra as we continued our work to revolutionize the treatment of dermatological diseases with our pipeline of first-in-class, engineered products delivered using topical live biotherapeutics," said Francisco Salva, CEO of Azitra. "A key highlight in 2025 was the progress made in our Phase 1/2 trial for ATR-04 targeting oncology patients with EGFRi-associated rash and the dosing of the trial's first patient. We were thrilled to have the opportunity to present this technology and the trial design to leaders in the field at the 2025 American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Annual Meeting, where we received positive feedback and encouraging interest."

"ATR-04 has previously been granted Fast Track designation from the FDA, signaling the potential for this candidate to help the approximately 150,000 people in the United States annually who are impacted by major dermatologic toxicities associated with EGFR inhibitor treatments. Though an impactful treatment for various serious cancers, EGFR inhibition can result in adverse skin reactions that can make it difficult for patients to stay on these effective therapies."

Mr. Salva added: "For our lead program, ATR-12, we continue to be encouraged by the promising safety data generated thus far in our Phase 1b trial and are optimistic that this candidate has the potential to be a life-changing innovation for people with Netherton syndrome, a rare, autosomal recessive disease, a chronic condition characterized by severe inflammation, pruritus, scaling, red, and dehydrated skin with no known cure and limited treatment options."

Mr. Salva continued: "Also in 2025, we presented positive preclinical data for our ATR-01 program targeting ichthyosis vulgaris. Impacting approximately 1.3 million in the United States with no treatment options beyond symptom management, ichthyosis vulgaris, is an autosomal semidominant genetic disorder caused by missing or abnormal filaggrin levels. The condition is characterized by generalized xerosis and fine, white to gray scales that are prominent on the abdomen, chest, and extensor surfaces of the extremities."

Mr. Salva concluded: "2026 promises to be an important year for Azitra with several anticipated milestones including topline data for both our Phase 1b study in Netherton Syndrome and the Phase 1/2 study in EGFRi-associated rash. We also look forward to completing IND-enabling studies for ATR-01. We remain excited and optimistic as we work towards these key events, which we believe can help build significant value for our shareholders in 2026, while we progress innovative and potentially transformative treatments for patients with severe and life-altering dermatological conditions."

Pipeline Achievements and Upcoming Milestones

ATR-12 - Advancing Phase 1b Clinical Trial in Netherton Syndrome

  • In June 2025, Azitra reported promising safety data with 50% of patients enrolled.
  • ATR12-351, a live precision dermatology therapeutic candidate has been generally safe and well-tolerated with occasional, transient, mild to moderate symptoms at application site to date.
  • Topline data from the Phase 1b trial is anticipated H2 2026.

ATR-04 — Addressing an Unmet Need for Cancer Patients in a Multi-billion Dollar Market Opportunity

  • Dosed first patient in Phase 1/2 Trial for ATR-04 program targeting oncology patients with EGFRi-associated rash in Q3 2025.
  • Topline data from first cohort of Phase 1/2 trial expected around mid-2026.

ATR-01 — Targeting Ichthyosis Vulgaris Which Impacts 1.3 million in the United States

  • Announced positive preclinical data for ATR-01 program in Q3 2025, demonstrating delivery of active, functional filaggrin through human stratum corneum and repair of damaged model skin
  • IND-enabling studies continue in 2026.

Financial Results for the Year Ended December 31, 2025

  • Research and Development (R&D) expenses: R&D expenses for the year ended December 31, 2025, were $4.8 million compared to $4.7 million for the fiscal year 2024.
  • General and Administrative (G&A) expenses: G&A expenses for the year ended December 31, 2025, were $6.2 million compared to $6.3 million for the fiscal year 2024.
  • Net Loss was $11.0 million for the year ended December 31, 2025, compared to $9.0 million for the fiscal year 2024.
  • Cash and cash equivalents: As of December 31, 2025, Azitra had cash and cash equivalents of $2.1 million.

About Azitra, Inc.

Azitra, Inc. is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company focused on developing innovative therapies for precision dermatology. Azitra's lead program, ATR-12, uses an engineered strain of S. epidermidis designed to treat Netherton syndrome, a rare, chronic skin disease with no approved treatment options. Netherton syndrome may be fatal in infancy with those living beyond a year having profound lifelong challenges. The ATR-12 program includes a Phase 1b clinical trial in adults with Netherton syndrome. ATR-04, Azitra's additional clinical program, utilizes another engineered strain of S. epidermidis for the treatment of EGFR inhibitor ("EGFRi") associated skin toxicity; a Phase 1/2 clinical trial has been initiated for this program. Azitra has received Fast Track designation from the United States Food and Drug Administration for this program to treat EGFRi associated rash, which impacts approximately 150,000 people in the United States. The ATR-12 and ATR-04 programs were developed from Azitra's proprietary platform of engineered proteins and topical live biotherapeutic products that includes a microbial library comprised of approximately 1,500 bacterial strains. The platform is augmented by artificial intelligence and machine learning technology that analyzes, predicts, and helps screen the library of strains for drug like molecules. For more information, please visit https://azitrainc.com.

Forward-Looking Statements

This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, as amended. These statements may be identified by words such as "aims," "anticipates," "believes," "could," "estimates," "expects," "forecasts," "goal," "intends," "may," "plans," "possible," "potential," "seeks," "will," and variations of these words or similar expressions that are intended to identify forward-looking statements. Any forward-looking statements in this press release are based on current expectations, estimates and projections only as of the date of this release and are subject to a number of risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially and adversely from those set forth in or implied by such forward-looking statements. Additional risks concerning Azitra's programs and operations are described or incorporated by reference in our annual report on Form 10-K filed with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission on February 27, 2026. data.title: 55 North Mining Announces Closing of Flow-Through Financing
data.description:
TORONTO, ON / ACCESS Newswire / February 27, 2026 / 55 North Mining Inc. (FSE:6YF) ("55 North" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that it has closed its previously announced non-brokered flow-through private placement (the "Private Placement").

Pursuant to the Private Placement, the Company issued 1,702,800 flow-through common shares ("FT Shares") at a price of $0.745 per FT Share for aggregate gross proceeds of $1,268,586.02.

The FT Shares entitle the holder to receive the tax benefits applicable to flow-through shares in accordance with the provisions of the Income Tax Act (Canada). No warrants were issued in connection with the Private Placement. All securities issued pursuant to the Private Placement are subject to a four-month hold period in accordance with applicable securities laws.

The gross proceeds raised from the Private Placement will be used to incur eligible Canadian exploration expenses that qualify as "flow-through mining expenditures" for purposes of the Income Tax Act (Canada), related to the exploration of the Company's Last Hope Gold Project.

The Company further confirms that exploration drilling activities are underway, with one drill rig currently operating on the Last Hope Gold Project. A more detailed operational update will be provided in a subsequent news release.

About 55 North Mining Inc.

55 North Mining Inc. is a Canadian exploration and development company advancing its high-grade Last Hope Gold Project located in Manitoba, Canada.

data.title: Data I/O Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
Data I/O Corporation, a leading global provider of data programming and security provisioning solutions, has released its financial results for the fourth quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company has made significant strides in its strategic transformation, focusing on new programming innovations and expanding its addressable market.

Financial Highlights

For the fourth quarter of 2025, Data I/O reported net sales of $4.0 million, a decrease from $5.2 million in the same period of 2024. The full-year net sales for 2025 were $21.5 million, slightly down from $21.8 million in 2024. The company faced challenges in the automotive electronics sector, which impacted its largest end market.

Gross margin for the fourth quarter of 2025 was 43.0%, down from 52.2% in the fourth quarter of 2024. The full-year gross margin was 49.3%, compared to 53.3% in 2024. Operating expenses for the fourth quarter were $4.2 million, including $312,000 in one-time expenses, compared to $4.0 million in the same period of 2024. The net loss for the fourth quarter of 2025 was ($2.5) million or ($0.27) per share, compared to a net loss of ($1.2) million or ($0.13) per share in the fourth quarter of 2024.

Business and Operational Highlights

Data I/O has made significant progress in its strategic transformation, approximately one year ahead of schedule. The company has invested in its core product roadmap for programming and automation, entered the Programming Services and Programming at Test markets, and collaborated with IAR for secure provisioning. The release of its first AI production code and the build-out of Edge AI present new revenue opportunities.

In 2025, consumable adapters and services represented 58% of total revenue, providing a stable base of recurring revenue. Capital equipment sales accounted for 42% of total revenue. The backlog on December 31, 2025, was $2.3 million, down from $2.7 million on September 30, 2025.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Data I/O has focused on reducing operating expenses, achieving a 7% reduction from $26.7 million to $24.8 million since November 2024, with plans for an additional $1 million annual run rate reduction within the first half of 2026. The company has also deployed AI across all functional departments to optimize business processes.

Management has made deliberate changes to the Board and executive suite to strengthen the leadership team, ensuring the right team is in place to drive the company's growth in 2026 and beyond.

Management's Perspective

William Wentworth, President and CEO of Data I/O Corporation, commented on the financial results, stating, "Our mission throughout 2025 was to transform Data I/O for long-term growth. As we enter 2026, our plan is proving to be about one year ahead of schedule and poised to deliver revenue growth this year. We have increasing confidence in the demand environment, with very encouraging customer activity in the fourth quarter and into 2026."

Wentworth highlighted the company's shift towards servicing the overall data provisioning market, which represents a significantly larger opportunity than the current market. He also emphasized the importance of the collaboration with IAR to create a comprehensive device support model for security provisioning in the industry.

Future Outlook

Data I/O has provided a business framework for 2026 based on organic growth, with potential incremental benefits from inorganic initiatives. The company aims for organic revenue growth over 2025, improved gross margins, and an additional $1 million run rate expense reduction. The company also has a line of sight to near-term positive operating cash flow.

Original SEC Filing: DATA I/O CORP [ DAIO ] - 8-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: STEWART INFORMATION SERVICES CORP SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Stewart Information Services Corporation, a leading provider of title insurance and real estate solutions, has released its 2025 Form 10-K report. The report highlights the company's robust financial performance, strategic initiatives, and the challenges it faces in a competitive market. Stewart's operations span globally, with significant growth in both domestic and international markets, driven by strategic acquisitions and innovative product offerings.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Operating Revenues: $2.86 billion, an 18% increase compared to 2024, driven by strong performances in title and real estate solutions services.
  • Net Income Attributable to Stewart: $115.5 million, or $4.05 per diluted share, compared to $73.3 million, or $2.61 per diluted share, in 2024.
  • Pretax Income Before Noncontrolling Interests: $165.6 million, with a 5.7% pretax margin, compared to $114.3 million, with a 4.6% pretax margin, in 2024.
  • Fourth Quarter Net Income Attributable to Stewart: $36.3 million, or $1.25 per diluted share, compared to $22.7 million, or $0.80 per diluted share, for the fourth quarter 2024.
  • Fourth Quarter Pretax Income Before Noncontrolling Interests: $51.7 million, with a 6.5% pretax margin, compared to $35.4 million, with a 5.3% pretax margin, for the prior year quarter.
  • Investment Income: $14.0 million for the fourth quarter 2025, a slight decrease of 3% compared to 2024.
  • Net Realized and Unrealized (Losses) Gains: $(3.7) million for the fourth quarter 2025, compared to $2.8 million gains in 2024, primarily due to losses in the title segment.
  • Employee Costs: $830.6 million, increased 11% in 2025 compared to 2024, driven by higher salaries and employee benefits.
  • Other Operating Expenses: $714.6 million, increased 18% in 2025 compared to 2024, primarily due to higher real estate solutions service expenses.
  • Title Losses and Related Claims: $81.7 million, with a 3.4% of title revenues, slightly increased by 2% compared to 2024.

Business Highlights

  • Title Insurance Segment: Stewart operates one of the largest global title insurance companies, providing services such as title examination, closing, and insurance. The segment also includes home and personal insurance services, tax-deferred exchanges, and digital customer engagement platform services.
  • Real Estate Solutions Segment: This segment supports the real estate mortgage industry by providing credit and real estate information services, property preservation and field services, valuation management services, online notarization and closing solutions, and search services. The acquisition of Mortgage Contracting Services (MCS) in 2025 expanded Stewart's servicer customer base.
  • Geographical Performance: Stewart operates primarily in the United States with regional offices in Australia, Canada, and the United Kingdom. Domestic commercial revenues saw significant growth, particularly in data center and energy asset classes, while international revenues increased due to higher residential transaction volumes.
  • Sales Units: In 2025, domestic commercial transactions closed improved by 13%, while combined purchase and refinancing orders increased by 1%. The average domestic commercial fee per file improved by 18% to $19,300.
  • New Product Launches: Stewart has developed and acquired numerous automated products and processes crucial to its operations, including trademarked products like AgencySecure®, AIM+®, and NotaryCam®.
  • Human Capital Resources: As of December 31, 2025, Stewart employed approximately 7,800 people, with a focus on inclusivity, continuous learning, and professional development. The company was recognized as a Top Workplace in 2025.
  • Future Outlook: For 2026, existing home sales are expected to improve by 7%, with the median existing home price remaining stable. The average 30-year mortgage interest rate is forecast to decline to 6.2% in 2026, with total mortgage originations expected to improve by 15%.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Initiatives: In 2025, Stewart completed the largest acquisition in its history by acquiring Mortgage Contracting Services (MCS), expanding its real estate solutions segment and broadening its servicer customer base. The company also focused on increasing scale and growth in key markets through acquisitions of various real estate solutions and title businesses, consistent with its strategy to enhance technology and service offerings.
  • Capital Management: The company issued 2,185,000 new shares of Common Stock, raising $140.8 million in net proceeds. It also increased its line of credit facility, drawing $200 million during the fourth quarter of 2025. The company paid dividends of $2.05 per common share in 2025, up from $1.95 in 2024, and increased its annual cash dividend to $2.10 per share starting in the third quarter of 2025. Additionally, the company maintained a debt-to-equity ratio of approximately 39% and a debt-to-capitalization ratio of 28% as of December 31, 2025.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates continued improvement in liquidity and capital resources to meet operational needs, with plans to potentially seek additional debt or equity funding for strategic goals or unforeseen circumstances. It expects to maintain sufficient cash flows from operations and cash available from underwriters, subject to regulatory restrictions, to fund operations and title claims payments. The company also plans to focus on cost management and operational efficiencies, including further automation and integration of acquisitions, to improve margins in its direct title and real estate solutions operations.

Challenges and Risks

  • Competitive Market: Stewart faces challenges in maintaining its competitive edge in the title insurance and real estate services industry, competing with significant players like Fidelity National Financial, First American, and Old Republic, which have greater resources.
  • Regulatory Environment: The company must navigate complex regulatory environments across various jurisdictions, which can impact its operations and profitability. Changes in regulations or new regulations could adversely affect the company’s ability to increase revenues and operating results.
  • Strategic Risks: Potential failure of acquisitions or strategic investments could lead to financial losses and integration challenges. The company also faces disruption risks from innovations and alternatives to traditional title insurance, such as AI-driven solutions and title insurance waivers.
  • Operational Risks: The need for secure, timely, and cost-effective technological responses to industry changes and regulatory requirements is critical. Economic conditions, particularly those affecting real estate and mortgage activity, pose a significant risk to revenue stability. Additionally, cybersecurity threats and errors in fund transfers present operational challenges.
  • Financial Risks: The company faces financial risks related to credit availability and interest rate fluctuations, which could impact liquidity and funding operations.
  • Management Strategies: Management highlights the importance of focusing on increasing profit margins, maintaining a high-quality agency network, and managing claims risk to drive consistent future performance. Balancing profitability, liquidity, and risk in investment strategies is emphasized to mitigate market risks.

data.title: Redwire Corp SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Redwire Corp, a leading provider of next-generation space infrastructure and defense technology solutions, has released its annual Form 10-K report. The report provides a comprehensive overview of the company's financial performance, business operations, strategic initiatives, and the challenges it faces in the current market environment.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenues: $335.4 million, reflecting a 10% increase from the previous year primarily due to the Edge Autonomy acquisition.
  • Gross Profit: $17.3 million, a decrease of 61% from the prior year, impacted by unfavorable EAC adjustments and non-cash expenses related to the Edge Autonomy acquisition.
  • Operating Income (Loss): $(229.7) million, a significant decline from the previous year, driven by increased SG&A expenses, transaction expenses, and impairment charges.
  • Net Income (Loss): $(226.6) million, compared to $(114.3) million in the prior year, influenced by higher interest expenses and impairment charges.
  • Net Income (Loss) Per Common Share: $(2.28), reflecting the increased net loss and higher weighted-average shares outstanding due to equity issuances.

Business Highlights

  • Space Segment Performance: Redwire's Space segment focuses on delivering next-generation spacecraft, large space infrastructure, and microgravity capabilities. The segment supported missions such as the International Space Station, ESA's PROBA missions, NASA's DART and Artemis I lunar mission, and the Space Force's GPS Satellite program.
  • Defense Tech Segment Performance: The Defense Tech segment delivers autonomous systems, optical sensors, and radio frequency payloads for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance. It serves customers like the U.S. Department of War, U.S. Federal Civilian Agencies, and allied governments.
  • Geographical Operations: Redwire operates out of 28 locations in North America and Europe, serving a diverse set of domestic and international customers across national security, civil, and commercial space and defense technology market segments.
  • New Product Launches: Redwire launched the Stalker Block 40, which offers enhanced performance over the Stalker Block 30, doubling flight endurance and payload capacity. The Penguin C Mk2 and Penguin C VTOL are also highlighted for their long-endurance and modular capabilities.
  • New Production Facilities: A new 85,000 square foot facility was opened in Ann Arbor, Michigan, to increase production of critical fuel cells, reflecting a key investment in a domestic, vertical integration strategy for Stalker UAS production.
  • Microgravity Development: Redwire's microgravity payloads on the ISS enable biotechnology applications, plant and animal science, and in-space manufacturing. The PIL-BOX payload has been launched 42 times, supporting partners like Bristol Myers Squibb and Eli Lilly.
  • Strategic Acquisitions: Redwire completed the acquisition of Edge Autonomy, enhancing its capabilities in uncrewed aerial systems. This acquisition contributed significantly to the Defense Tech segment's revenue growth.
  • Future Outlook: Redwire aims to continue its growth through strategic acquisitions, bundled sales, and increased offering integrations. The company is also focused on developing critical infrastructure for lunar exploration as part of NASA's Artemis program.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Acquisitions: Redwire Corporation focused on expanding its capabilities through strategic acquisitions, notably the acquisition of Edge Autonomy, which enhanced its Defense Tech segment. The company also opened a new facility in Ann Arbor, Michigan, to increase production of critical fuel cells, reflecting a key investment in a domestic, vertical integration strategy for Stalker UAS production.
  • Capital Management: The company engaged in significant capital management activities, including issuing common stock through an ATM facility, equity offerings, and the exercise of public and private warrants, raising $518.4 million. Redwire also repurchased $63.9 million of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock and converted a portion of its convertible preferred stock into common stock, enhancing its equity base. Additionally, the company managed its debt obligations by repaying all outstanding principal balances of the term loans and revolving credit facility under the Adams Street Credit Agreement and entering into a new JPMorgan Credit Agreement.
  • Future Outlook: Redwire plans to continue strengthening its financial and liquidity position by exploring opportunities for additional equity or debt securities issuance, refinancing, or restructuring existing credit facilities. The company aims to support its growth initiatives and general corporate needs through strategic investments in facilities, equipment, technologies, and research and development. Redwire believes its existing sources of liquidity will be sufficient to meet its working capital needs and debt service obligations for at least the next twelve months.

Challenges and Risks

  • Market Risks: The company faces significant market risks due to economic uncertainty, including high inflation, market volatility, and potential macroeconomic downturns. These factors could affect the company's cost of capital, financial condition, and results of operations. Additionally, geopolitical events, such as the war in Ukraine, could impact demand for the company's products and services.
  • Operational Risks: Operational risks include the company's reliance on a limited number of suppliers for raw materials and components, which could lead to supply chain disruptions and increased costs. The integration of recent acquisitions, such as Edge Autonomy, presents challenges in realizing anticipated synergies and benefits, which could adversely affect operations and financial condition.
  • Regulatory Risks: Regulatory risks are heightened by the company's dependence on U.S. government contracts, which are subject to budgetary constraints and regulatory compliance requirements. Changes in government spending priorities or failure to comply with regulations could materially impact the company's business.
  • Emerging Risks: Emerging risks include the use of artificial intelligence in the company's offerings, which presents challenges related to cybersecurity, ethical considerations, and potential regulatory changes. The company must manage these risks to avoid reputational harm and legal liability.
  • Management Strategies: Management has identified the need to continue investing in the development and refinement of proprietary technologies to remain competitive. The company is focused on addressing supply chain vulnerabilities and integrating recent acquisitions to enhance operational efficiency.
  • Market Risk Exposure: The company is exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, particularly between the euro and U.S. dollar, which may impact revenues and cash flows. Additionally, the potential for increased tariffs and trade restrictions could affect the cost structure and demand for the company's products internationally.

SEC Filing: Redwire Corp [ RDW ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: NBT BANCORP INC SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
NBT Bancorp Inc., a financial holding company headquartered in Norwich, New York, has released its 2025 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial performance and strategic growth. The company, which provides commercial banking, retail banking, and wealth management services across several states in the northeastern United States, has demonstrated resilience and strategic foresight in a volatile economic environment.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Income: $169.2 million, up $28.6 million from the previous year, reflecting the company's ability to manage volatility in the interest rate environment.
  • Diluted EPS: $3.33, an increase from $2.97 in the prior year, indicating improved profitability per share.
  • Net Interest Income: $501.5 million, up $101.4 million or 25.3% from 2024, driven by higher asset yields and the Evans acquisition.
  • Operating Net Income: $194.5 million, a non-GAAP measure, showing a significant increase from $139.7 million in 2024, highlighting core business performance.
  • Noninterest Income: $195.3 million, excluding securities gains (losses), up 12.2% from the prior year, primarily due to increased retirement plan administration fees and wealth management fees.

Business Highlights

  • Company Overview: NBT Bancorp Inc. is a financial holding company headquartered in Norwich, New York, primarily providing commercial banking, retail banking, and wealth management services across upstate New York, northeastern Pennsylvania, southern New Hampshire, western Massachusetts, Vermont, southern Maine, and central and northwestern Connecticut.
  • Business Philosophy: The company operates as a community-oriented financial institution, emphasizing local decision-making and offering a broad array of banking and financial services to retail, commercial, and municipal customers.
  • Revenue Segments: The principal sources of revenue for NBT Bancorp Inc. include management fees and dividends from its subsidiaries, primarily NBT Bank, NBT Financial, and NBT Holdings.
  • Geographical Performance: The acquisition of Evans Bancorp, Inc. in 2025 enhanced the company's presence in Western New York, including the Buffalo and Rochester communities, indicating a strategic expansion in these regions.
  • New Product Launches: The NBT iSelect Account, introduced in 2021, continues to be a significant product offering, meeting the Bank On National Account Standards and providing accessible banking options for unbanked and underbanked individuals.
  • Community Engagement: The company is actively involved in community support, contributing over $3 million in 2025 to various organizations and encouraging employee volunteerism, with 12,500 hours of service reported.
  • Environmental Initiatives: NBT Bancorp Inc. is committed to sustainability, implementing energy conservation measures in its facilities and promoting environmentally friendly banking services like mobile and online banking.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates an improving interest rate environment in 2026, with expectations of GDP growth driven by AI investment and strong consumer spending. The focus remains on long-term strategies, including market growth, revenue diversification, and technology investments.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Initiatives: In 2025, NBT Bancorp Inc. completed the acquisition of Evans Bancorp, Inc., enhancing its presence in Western New York. This strategic move was aimed at expanding market reach and diversifying revenue sources. The company also focused on long-term strategies including growth in its markets, diversification of revenue sources, improving operating efficiencies, and investing in technology.
  • Capital Management: NBT Bancorp Inc. actively managed its capital by redeeming $118 million of subordinated debt in July 2025, which had a weighted average rate of 5.45%, using existing liquidity sources. This move was part of a broader strategy to optimize the capital structure and reduce interest expenses. The company also issued 5.1 million shares of common stock as part of the Evans acquisition, reflecting a strategic use of equity to fund growth initiatives. Additionally, the company maintained a 'well capitalized' status in accordance with regulatory standards, with capital measurements well in excess of regulatory minimum guidelines.
  • Future Outlook: Looking ahead to 2026, NBT Bancorp Inc. plans to continue its focus on strategic growth through market expansion, revenue diversification, and technology investments. The company anticipates an improving interest rate environment, which is expected to benefit the banking industry. Future decreases in rates by the Federal Reserve will be determined by labor market conditions and inflation levels. The company remains committed to managing liquidity and capital resources effectively to support its strategic initiatives.

Challenges and Risks

  • Local Economic Vulnerability: The company operates primarily in upstate New York and surrounding areas, making it vulnerable to local economic downturns. The acquisition of Evans Bancorp, Inc. in 2025 expanded its presence in Western New York, but also introduced integration risks and potential asset quality issues.
  • Macroeconomic Risks: The company faces significant risks from macroeconomic conditions, including consumer confidence, unemployment, and interest rate changes, which can impact consumer spending and demand for credit. The reliance on interest and fees from loan receivables makes it sensitive to economic volatility. Additionally, the company is exposed to risks from severe weather and climate change, which could affect its branch locations and customer properties.
  • Commercial Lending Risks: The company’s focus on commercial lending, which constitutes 56% of its loan portfolio, exposes it to higher risks of non-payment and loss compared to residential mortgages. The allowance for credit losses may not be sufficient to cover actual loan losses, posing a material risk to financial condition.
  • Regulatory Risks: Regulatory risks are heightened due to the company exceeding $10 billion in total consolidated assets, subjecting it to increased capital, leverage, liquidity, and risk management standards. Compliance with these requirements may necessitate significant resources and could impact financial results.
  • Operational Risks: Operational risks include reliance on third-party vendors for key business infrastructure, which could affect service delivery if these vendors face disruptions. The company also faces cybersecurity risks, with increasing threats from cyber-attacks that could compromise sensitive information and disrupt operations.
  • Interest Rate Fluctuations: Management acknowledges the challenges posed by interest rate fluctuations, which could adversely affect net interest income. The company is also focused on managing liquidity risk, especially in light of competitive pressures on deposit pricing and potential loan growth exceeding deposit growth.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks from variations in interest rates, which could impact its net interest margin and financial condition. High interest rates may reduce loan origination and increase funding costs, while low rates could lead to asset prepayments and lower yields.

SEC Filing: NBT BANCORP INC [ NBTB ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: BYLINE BANCORP, INC. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Byline Bancorp, Inc., headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, has released its 2025 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial performance and strategic growth. The company, operating through its subsidiary Byline Bank, offers a wide range of banking products and services primarily in the Chicago metropolitan area. The report highlights significant achievements in revenue growth, strategic acquisitions, and operational efficiency, while also addressing the challenges and risks faced in a competitive financial services industry.

Financial Highlights

Byline Bancorp, Inc. reported strong financial results for 2025, driven by growth in its loan and lease portfolio and lower rates paid on deposits. Key financial metrics include:

  • Total Revenue: $446.3 million, reflecting significant growth.
  • Net Interest Income: $385.3 million, an increase of 10.7% compared to 2024.
  • Net Income: $130.1 million, up 7.7% from the previous year.
  • Basic Earnings Per Common Share: $2.90, compared to $2.78 in 2024.
  • Diluted Earnings Per Common Share: $2.89, compared to $2.75 in 2024.
  • Net Interest Margin: 4.22%, an increase from 3.97% in 2024.
  • Provision for Credit Losses: $36.1 million, reflecting growth in the loan and lease portfolio.
  • Non-Interest Income: $60.9 million, up 3.5% from 2024.
  • Non-Interest Expense: $236.9 million, primarily due to higher salaries and merger-related expenses.
  • Efficiency Ratio: 51.83%, improved from 52.45% in 2024.

Business Highlights

Byline Bancorp, Inc. continues to strengthen its market position through a diverse range of banking services and strategic geographical focus. Key business highlights include:

  • Business Overview: Byline Bancorp operates as a bank holding company through its subsidiary, Byline Bank, offering services to small and medium-sized businesses, commercial real estate, financial sponsors, and consumers.
  • Product and Service Offerings: The company provides commercial banking services, small business capital through U.S. government guaranteed lending programs, community banking services, small ticket equipment leasing, and trust and wealth management services.
  • Geographical Focus: Byline operates 44 branches in the Chicago metropolitan area and one in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin, with SBA lending services across multiple states.
  • Branch Network and Distribution Channels: The company has strategically reduced its branch network from 88 to 45 since 2013, focusing on growth and consolidation.
  • Small Business Lending: Byline Bank was the tenth most active originator of SBA 7(a) loans in the U.S. and the most active in Illinois for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2025.
  • Equipment Leasing: Byline Financial Group had $752.3 million in leases outstanding as of December 31, 2025.
  • Human Capital: The company emphasizes workforce development, with 1,027 employees primarily in the Chicagoland and greater Milwaukee areas.
  • Future Outlook: Byline plans to leverage its management team and market opportunities in Chicago to drive future growth, deepen client relationships, and diversify revenue.

Strategic Initiatives

Byline Bancorp, Inc. has undertaken several strategic initiatives to strengthen its financial position and support long-term growth:

  • Strategic Acquisition: The acquisition of First Security in 2025 contributed to the growth in the loan and lease portfolio, enhancing the company's market position and expanding its customer base.
  • Capital Management: Total stockholders' equity increased by $176.4 million or 16.2% to $1.3 billion as of December 31, 2025. The company also reduced total borrowings and other liabilities by $209.1 million or 22.1%.
  • Dividends: Dividends declared and paid on common shares increased to $18.2 million in 2025 from $15.9 million in 2024, reflecting a commitment to returning value to shareholders.
  • Future Outlook: Byline plans to maintain a robust allowance for credit losses and manage its capital efficiently, anticipating further growth in its loan and lease portfolio through strategic acquisitions and organic growth. The effective tax rate is expected to be approximately 25% to 27% in 2026.

Challenges and Risks

Byline Bancorp, Inc. faces several challenges and risks in the competitive financial services industry:

  • Credit and Interest Rate Risks: Managing credit risk is crucial to avoid defaults and increased charge-offs. Interest rate fluctuations may impact earnings and the fair value of securities.
  • Operational Risks: Challenges in implementing growth strategies, managing costs, and integrating new lines of business or technologies could lower profitability. Reliance on third-party vendors poses additional risks.
  • Regulatory Risks: Compliance with evolving regulations, particularly those related to consumer protection and privacy, could increase operational costs. Surpassing $10 billion in assets may lead to increased regulation.
  • External Risks: Economic conditions, especially in the Chicago area, could affect financial performance. Real estate market volatility poses a risk due to the significant portion of the loan portfolio secured by real estate.
  • Technology Risks: The rapid pace of technological change presents both opportunities and risks. Failure to effectively implement and manage new technologies could impact competitiveness and operational efficiency.

SEC Filing: BYLINE BANCORP, INC. [ BY ] - 10-K - Feb. 27, 2026

data.title: US agency approves Charter Communications’ $34.5 billion deal to buy Cox
data.description:
By David Shepardson

The Federal Communications Commission said on Friday it approved Charter Communications’ $34.5 billion acquisition of Cox Communications.

The deal announced in March 2025 combines two of the largest U.S. cable and broadband operators in their battle with streaming companies and mobile carriers.

The FCC said Spectrum-owner Charter will invest billions of dollars to upgrade its network and deliver high-speed service, and the company committed to onshoring jobs. Charter also agreed to extend its $20/hour minimum starting wage to Cox workers.

Reuters reported last year the deal would create the largest U.S. cable TV and broadband provider with around 38 million subscribers, surpassing market leader Comcast .

FCC Chair Brendan Carr said the deal "means that customers will get access to lower priced plans."

Cox provides broadband, cable television, voice, and wireless services to 6.3 million customers. Charter told the FCC it would upgrade Cox’s broadband network, resulting in significantly faster broadband speeds in Cox’s service territory through a faster process than without the deal.

Charter declined to comment.

Like other recent transactions involving Verizon, T-Mobile, AT&T and Paramount, the FCC required Charter to commit to not use diversity, equity and inclusion programs as a condition of approval. President Donald Trump issued an executive order seeking to ban DEI programs in January 2025 and has pressured businesses to comply.

The FCC said Charter had "modified its practices and is committed to a work environment free from invidious discrimination."

The companies said they expect to realize $500 million in cost savings within three years of the deal's expected close in mid-2026.

Under the cash-and-stock deal, Charter will take on about $12.6 billion of Cox's net debt and other obligations, giving the transaction an enterprise value of $34.5 billion.

The combined firm will rebrand as Cox Communications within a year of the deal's close, with Charter's Spectrum being the consumer-facing brand. Charter and Cox had also discussed a merger in 2013 before shelving the plan.

data.title: A history of Warner Bros - from old Hollywood to streaming era
data.description:
Warner Bros Discovery on Friday entered an agreement to be acquired by Paramount Skydance in a $110 billion deal, ending a high‑stakes bidding war after Netflix withdrew from its agreement with the HBO Max owner.

Here is a timeline from the founding of Time Inc and Warner Bros to the company's latest breakup and potential sale.

Date

Event

1923

Warner Bros was founded by brothers Harry, Albert, Sam and Jack Warner as a film studio in Hollywood. It revolutionized cinema with the introduction of synchronized sound in films.

1969

Kinney National Company, a conglomerate that later transitioned into media, buys Warner Bros-Seven Arts and later spins off its non-media businesses.

1972

HBO is founded by Charles Dolan with backing from Time. It was the first U.S. subscription-based cable network, offering uncut, commercial-free movies and live sports, pioneering premium cable television.

1990

Time Inc merges with Warner Communications in a $14 billion deal, hailed as a "marriage of content and distribution", creating Time Warner, then the largest media company in the world.

1996

Time Warner merges with Turner Broadcasting, gaining Cartoon Network, CNN, TNT and a vast film library of classic films.

2000

Time Warner merges with AOL, forming AOL Time Warner, the largest merger in history at the time, aiming to marry traditional and digital media.

2002

AOL Time Warner merger begins to unravel as AOL's value collapses with the launch of an SEC investigation, prompted by allegations of accounting irregularities and inflated revenue reports at AOL.

2003

CEO Steve Case resigns from AOL Time Warner.

2004

Time Warner sells Warner Music to a private equity group led by Edgar Bronfman Jr. for $2.6 billion.

2009

Time Warner fully spins off Time Warner Cable, which had already been partially separated in 2007, ending its role in cable distribution.

2009

Time Warner spins off AOL.

2013

Time Warner spins off Time, its magazine division, which includes Time, People, Fortune and Sports Illustrated, marking its formal exit from publishing.

2016

AT&T announces acquisition of Time Warner for $85 billion.

2018

AT&T completes its acquisition of Time Warner after regulator approval, renaming it WarnerMedia.

2021

AT&T announces it will spin off WarnerMedia and merge it with Discovery Inc to create a new standalone media company.

2022

WarnerMedia and Discovery complete their merger in a $43 billion deal.

June 9, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery announces it will separate into two companies — one focusing on streaming and studios businesses, while the second will house its cable TV assets.

October 21, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery's board rejects a Paramount Skydance offer of nearly $60 billion, or $24 per share, a source familiar with the matter exclusively tells Reuters. The company says it is weighing a potential sale amid interest from several suitors.

November 18, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery's board wants Paramount Skydance to sweeten its bid to $30 per share, valuing the company at $74.34 billion, Axios reports.

November 21, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery receives preliminary buyout bids from Paramount Skydance, Comcast and Netflix — who were asked to improve their offers.

December 1, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery receives a second round of bids, including a mostly cash offer from Netflix.

December 4, 2025

Paramount Skydance accuses Warner Bros Discovery of running an unfair sale process that favors Netflix over other bidders, CNBC reports, citing a letter sent by the newly merged media company.

December 5, 2025

Netflix is in exclusive talks to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and television studios along with its streaming assets after offering $28 per share, a source says.

December 5, 2025

Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros Discovery's film and TV studios and streaming division for $72 billion, or $27.75 per share.

December 9, 2025

Paramount Skydance makes a hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery in a deal valued at $108.4 billion or $30 per share.

December 17, 2025

Warner Bros Discovery's board rejects Paramount Skydance's hostile $108.4 billion bid, saying it failed to provide adequate financing assurances.

December 23, 2025

Paramount Skydance amends its offer to buy Warner Bros Discovery to include a $40.4 billion personal guarantee from Larry Ellison.

January 7, 2026

Warner Bros Discovery rejects Paramount Skydance's amended hostile bid despite Larry Ellison's guarantee.

January 12, 2026

Paramount Skydance files lawsuit to force Warner Bros Discovery to disclose details of its deal with Netflix and plans to nominate directors to Warner Bros Discovery's board.

January 20, 2026

Netflix amends its bid to an all‑cash offer for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming units and secures unanimous approval from the Warner Bros board without increasing the $82.7 billion purchase price.

January 22, 2026

Paramount Skydance extends its hostile tender offer for Warner Bros Discovery to February 20, seeking more time to win investors.

February 3, 2026

U.S. senators grill Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos at a hearing over how the company's acquisition of Warner Bros Discovery would affect competition in the entertainment industry.

February 5, 2026

U.S. President Donald Trump says he will stay out of the bidding war for Warner Bros Discovery, a reversal from his comments late last year.

February 10, 2026

Paramount Skydance revises its $30-per-share all-cash offer for Warner Bros, adding a 25-cent-per-share fee for every quarter the transaction does not close beyond December 31, 2026. Paramount also says it will fund the $2.8 billion termination fee Warner Bros owes Netflix if the deal falls through.

February 17, 2026

Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised bid and gives the Hollywood Studio seven days to see if it can come up with a better deal to buy the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise.

February 24, 2026

Warner Bros Discovery says it is considering a sweetened bid from Paramount Skydance without disclosing the value of the deal.

February 24, 2026

Warner Bros Discovery opens the door to Paramount after its CEO, David Ellison, raises the offer to $31 per share.

February 26, 2026

Netflix refuses to raise its offer for Warner Bros after the coveted Hollywood studio said Paramount Skydance's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with the streaming giant.

February 27, 2026

Paramount pays the $2.80 billion termination fee that Warner Bros owed Netflix, streaming giant discloses in SEC filing

February 27, 2026

Warner Bros Discovery enters an agreement to be acquired by Paramount Skydance at $81 billion in equity value, in a transaction expected to close in the third quarter of 2026.

data.title: SLS Stokes Retail Anticipation For Breakout Rally — What’s Driving The Interest?
data.description:
Key points:
  • The ongoing GPS trial is an overall survival study and final analysis is expected once 80 deaths have occurred.
  • As of Dec. 26, 72 deaths have occurred, the company said earlier, highlighting that it had previously expected 80 patient deaths to occur by December end.
  • Maxim analyst Jason McCarthy previously noted that delays in an event-driven trial like SELLAS’ could be suggestive of extended survival benefit from GPS.

Shares of Sellas Life Sciences (SLS) garnered the spotlight on Stocktwits on Friday as retail traders contemplated the company’s upcoming results from its late-stage trial for Galinpepimut-S (GPS).

SELLAS is currently evaluating Galinpepimut-S (GPS) as a potential maintenance therapy in patients with Acute Myeloid Leukemia who have achieved complete remission following second-line salvage therapy.

AML is a fast-growing cancer of the blood and bone marrow where immature white blood cells build up, crowding out healthy cells, leading to fatigue, infections, and bleeding.

How Did Stocktwits Users React?

A Stocktwits user expressed optimism for data from the trial spurring a rally. “Till then it’s the accumulation game,” he said.

https://www.stocktwits.com/Heypentaco/message/646154506

Another opined that the GPS will be worth over $180/share to big pharma companies looking to buy Sellas.

https://www.stocktwits.com/67X_ROI_Q1_2026/message/646149937

Another user opined that now is the time to buy more shares of the company.

https://www.stocktwits.com/Polsky/message/646158337

Overall, retail sentiment around SLS stock stayed within the ‘extremely bullish’ territory over the past 24 hours, while message volume remained at ‘high’ levels. According to Stocktwits data, retail chatter around the stock has increased by about 453% over the past 90 days.

The GPS Trial

The ongoing GPS trial is an overall survival study and final analysis is expected once 80 deaths have occurred. As of Dec. 26, 72 deaths have occurred, the company said earlier, highlighting that it had previously expected 80 patient deaths to occur by December end.

“While the 80th event has not yet occurred, and we remain fully blinded, every passing month may increase the probability of a successful study as highlighted by key opinion leaders in our recent R&D event. Conclusive data will follow the unblinding and analyses of the study results,” SELLAS CEO Angelos Stergiou then said.

Maxim analyst Jason McCarthy then noted that delays in an event-driven trial like SELLAS’ could be suggestive of extended survival benefit from GPS.

According to data from Koyfin, all three of the analysts covering SELLAS rate it ‘Buy’ or higher. The stock has an average price target of $6.83, hinting at further potential upside.

SLS shares have more than quadrupled over the past 12 months.
